description:
The hear no evil monkey, called Kikazaru (Japanese for “hear not”), one of the Three Wise Monkeys. Depicted as the brown üêµ Monkey Face with hands covering its ears.

The Three Wise Monkeys represent the proverb see no evil, hear no evil, speak no evil, frequently interpreted as a call for discretion or willful ignorance.

Often used as a playful way to convey I can’t believe what I’m hearing! or, more generally, to express astonishment or disbelief.

apple_vendor_description: The hear no evil monkey emoji on Apple devices features a charming primate with its hands delicately covering its ears, rendered with Apple's signature glossy 3D shading and expressive facial features. The rounded edges and subtle highlights give it a soft, approachable appearance, embodying the proverb of not listening to or engaging with negativity. This emoji is often used humorously to indicate a desire to ignore something unpleasant or to playfully feign ignorance on Apple devices.
